trans-unit.source: The deployment script will skip creation of the virtual environment on Azure if it detects that a compatible virtual environment already exists.
trans-unit.target: The deployment script will skip creation of the virtual environment on Azure if it detects that a compatible virtual environment already exists.

trans-unit.source: This can speed up deployment considerably.
trans-unit.target: This can speed up deployment considerably.

trans-unit.source: Packages that are already installed will be skipped by pip.
trans-unit.target: Packages that are already installed will be skipped by pip.

trans-unit.source: In certain situations, you may want to force delete that virtual environment.
trans-unit.target: In certain situations, you may want to force delete that virtual environment.

trans-unit.source: You'll want to do this if you decide to include a virtual environment as part of your repository.
trans-unit.target: You'll want to do this if you decide to include a virtual environment as part of your repository.

trans-unit.source: You may also want to do this if you need to get rid of certain packages, or test changes to requirements.txt.
trans-unit.target: You may also want to do this if you need to get rid of certain packages, or test changes to requirements.txt.

trans-unit.source: There are a few options to manage the existing virtual environment on Azure:
trans-unit.target: There are a few options to manage the existing virtual environment on Azure:

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Use FTP
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Use FTP

trans-unit.source: With an FTP client, connect to the server and you'll be able to delete the env folder.
trans-unit.target: With an FTP client, connect to the server and you'll be able to delete the env folder.

trans-unit.source: Note that some FTP clients (such as web browsers) may be read-only and won't allow you to delete folders, so you'll want to make sure to use an FTP client with that capability.
trans-unit.target: Note that some FTP clients (such as web browsers) may be read-only and won't allow you to delete folders, so you'll want to make sure to use an FTP client with that capability.

trans-unit.source: The FTP host name and user are displayed in the your web app's blade on the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The FTP host name and user are displayed in the your web app's blade on the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Toggle runtime
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Toggle runtime

trans-unit.source: Here's an alternative that takes advantage of the fact that the deployment script will delete the env folder when it doesn't match the desired version of Python.
trans-unit.target: Here's an alternative that takes advantage of the fact that the deployment script will delete the env folder when it doesn't match the desired version of Python.

trans-unit.source: This will effectively delete the existing environment, and create a new one.
trans-unit.target: This will effectively delete the existing environment, and create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Switch to a different version of Python (via runtime.txt or the Application Settings blade in the Azure Portal)
trans-unit.target: Switch to a different version of Python (via runtime.txt or the Application Settings blade in the Azure Portal)

trans-unit.source: git push some changes (ignore any pip install errors if any)
trans-unit.target: git push some changes (ignore any pip install errors if any)

trans-unit.source: Switch back to initial version of Python
trans-unit.target: Switch back to initial version of Python

trans-unit.source: git push some changes again
trans-unit.target: git push some changes again

trans-unit.source: Option 3: Customize deployment script
trans-unit.target: Option 3: Customize deployment script

trans-unit.source: If you've customized the deployment script, you can change the code in deploy.cmd to force it to delete the env folder.
trans-unit.target: If you've customized the deployment script, you can change the code in deploy.cmd to force it to delete the env folder.
